keyword: how many calories in a large chicken breast
title: How Many Calories in a Large Chicken Breast?
meta_description: Learn how many calories in a large chicken breast (about 200g cooked, skinless), plus full nutrition breakdown including protein, fat, carbs, and tips for variations.
h1: How Many Calories in a Large Chicken Breast?
assumptions: Skinless, boneless, cooked (grilled or roasted), no added oil/sauce; large size assumed as 200 g.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by cut, cooking method, added ingredients, and exact size; check labels or use a scale for precision.

quick_answer.text: A large cooked, skinless chicken breast (200g) contains about 330 kcal and 62 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaging info.

tweaks.label: Add 1 tsp olive oil for cooking per 100 g
Breaded and fried (vs. grilled) per 100 g

faqs.q: How many calories in a large chicken breast?
faqs.a: Approximately 330 kcal for a 200g cooked, skinless large chicken breast.

faqs.q: How much protein is in a large chicken breast?
faqs.a: About 62 g of protein in a 200g cooked, skinless portion.

faqs.q: Are there carbs in chicken breast?
faqs.a: Plain chicken breast has 0 g carbs; additions like breading or sauce can add them.

faqs.q: Does cooking method affect calories in chicken breast?
faqs.a: Yesâ€”grilling keeps it low; frying or adding oil increases calories significantly.

faqs.q: What size is a large chicken breast?
faqs.a: Typically 200-250 g raw, yielding about 150-200 g cooked; values here assume 200 g cooked.
